column3: T/O from Escort was also used for 1 minute. Student needed to leave classroom because of constant disruption of the educational process. Student put the rope from the blinds around his neck. Student was escorted out of alternative location because he was unsafe.
Ran out of classroom because he had to wait for a facetime with staff. Spent 1.5 hours outside the classroom. Ended up shattering window in the office and was put in a restraint.
Student came into the class after a break. He began to yell and disrupt the class. After several prompts to stop
column4: he continued and the class left the room. He ran out of the room and eventually out of the building. Support escorted him to TO. He stayed out of the classroom until the end of the day per plan.

column3: Unable to follow directions when asked to line up for PE. Had to stay behind until he could follow directions. Eventually was given a choice to wither go to a calming space or TO. Did not make a choice so walked to TO and stayed until calm.
Was in a calming area and began to jump on table and throw objects. Eloped from the room and eventually walked into TO where he stayed until he was calm

BN was upset from being outside. Was asked to take 5 deep breaths. Ran and was playing on elevator then stood on water fountain (support was called). Ran back to elevator and then turned on water at water jug. Escorted to TO (1 min). In TO
column4: Bryce peed on floor. Was able to clean TO and do reflection sheet and work. TO time

column3: Student had to sit minutes before recess
column4: he was not following directions to put his toys away before sitting minutes. He eloped from the classroom where he began kicking windows in the doors
column7: and pressing buttons repeatedly in the elevator. Support was called and he was escorted to TO to calm.
